intro: Eatonella, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Eatonella is known for its ability to bloom in early spring, often before many other plants. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
